Description: Bowl and tondo sherd of Attic, perhaps black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: wall glazed; tondo border consists of frieze of staggered double dots between two sets of three narrow bands; trace of added white dot between tops of (lost) tongues to the centre; exterior: reserved handle zone with line at lower edge; at far left of sherd, trace of black, probably part of handle-palmette volute; lower wall black with reserved band.
Curator's comments: According to Robertson, the absence of a relief line between tongues on the tondo makes it unlikely that this sherd belongs with British Museum 1948, 0815.11 and 1948,0815.12.
Bibliographic references: Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 148, no. 10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 384, no. B543)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 231, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0429) (Phase 1)
